com.teamcenter.jdbc.sqlprocessors

Class TcJdbcSqlProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.teamcenter.jdbc.sqlprocessors.TcJdbcSqlProcessor

  • public class TcJdbcSqlProcessor
extends java.lang.Object
    The SQL Processor engine that can establish a session with the Teamcenter Oracle Database and execute some queries and returns the results. This class also has API for closing the open resources.
    Author:
    Pavan Kumar Dittakavi
    See Also:
    https://github.com/pawanit17/JDBC-Interaction-With-Teamcenter-DB

    • Method Detail

      • getDbConnection

        public java.sql.Connection getDbConnection()
                                    throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                           java.sql.SQLException
        Method to establish a connection with the underlying Oracle database using the JDBC thin-driver.
        Returns:
        A connection object encapsulating the actual database connection to the program.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - If an attempt to load the class specified in Class.forName method fails.
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database access error occurs or the url is null

      • executeSQL

        public java.sql.ResultSet executeSQL(java.lang.String sqlToExecute)
                              throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                     java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Method to execute the SQL provided as input. This method would also own the responsibility for creating a connection object if there isn't already one existing.
        Parameters:
        sqlToExecute: - The SQL provided by the called to execute.
        Returns:
        The SQL ResultSet containing the response of the SQL execution.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database access error occurs or this method is called on a closed connection.
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - If the Database driver class could not be loaded for a connection.

      • closeResources

        public void closeResources()
                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Method to close the resources.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database access error occurs.
